00052 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00053 //  STRUCT : sc_bind_proxy
00054 //
00055 //  Struct for temporarily storing a pointer to an interface or port.
00056 //  Used for positional binding.
00057 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00058 
00059 struct SC_API sc_bind_proxy
00060 {
00061     sc_interface* iface;
00062     sc_port_base* port;
00063     
00064     sc_bind_proxy();
00065     sc_bind_proxy( sc_interface& );
00066     sc_bind_proxy( sc_port_base& );
00067 };
00068 
00069 
00070 extern SC_API const sc_bind_proxy SC_BIND_PROXY_NIL;
00071 
00072 
00073 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00074 //  CLASS : sc_module
00075 //
00076 //  Base class for all structural entities.
00077 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00078 
00079 class SC_API sc_module
00080 : public sc_object, public sc_process_host
00081 {
00082     friend class sc_module_name;
00083     friend class sc_module_registry;
00084     friend class sc_object;
00085     friend class sc_port_registry;
00086         friend class sc_process_b;
00087     friend class sc_simcontext;
00088 
00089 public:
00090 
00091     sc_simcontext* sc_get_curr_simcontext()
00092         { return simcontext(); }
00093 
00094     // to generate unique names for objects in an MT-Safe way
00095     const char* gen_unique_name( const char* basename_, bool preserve_first );
00096 
00097     virtual const char* kind() const
00098         { return "sc_module"; }
00099 
00100 protected:
00101   
00102     // called by construction_done 
00103     virtual void before_end_of_elaboration();
00104 
00105     void construction_done();
00106 
00107     // called by elaboration_done (does nothing by default)
00108     virtual void end_of_elaboration();
00109 
00110     void elaboration_done( bool& );
00111 
00112     // called by start_simulation (does nothing by default)
00113     virtual void start_of_simulation();
00114 
00115     void start_simulation();
00116 
00117     // called by simulation_done (does nothing by default)
00118     virtual void end_of_simulation();
00119 
00120     void simulation_done();
00121 
00122     void sc_module_init();
00123 
00124     // constructor
00125     sc_module();
00126     sc_module( const sc_module_name& nm ); /* for those used to old style */
00127 
00128     /* DEPRECATED */ sc_module( const char* nm ); 
00129     /* DEPRECATED */ sc_module( const std::string& nm );
00130 
00131 public:
00132 
00133     // destructor
00134     virtual ~sc_module();
00135 
00136     // positional binding methods
00137 
00138     sc_module& operator << ( sc_interface& );
00139     sc_module& operator << ( sc_port_base& );
00140 
00141     sc_module& operator , ( sc_interface& interface_ )
00142         { return operator << ( interface_ ); }
00143 
00144     sc_module& operator , ( sc_port_base& port_ )
00145         { return operator << ( port_ ); }
00146 
00147     // operator() is declared at the end of the class.
00148 
00149     const ::std::vector<sc_object*>& get_child_objects() const;
00150 
00151 protected:
00152 
00153     // this must be called by user-defined modules
00154     void end_module();
00155 
00156 
00157     // to prevent initialization for SC_METHODs and SC_THREADs
00158     void dont_initialize();
00159 
00160     // positional binding code - used by operator ()
00161 
00162     void positional_bind( sc_interface& );
00163     void positional_bind( sc_port_base& );
00164 
00165     // set reset sensitivity for SC_xTHREADs
00166     void async_reset_signal_is( const sc_in<bool>& port, bool level );
00167     void async_reset_signal_is( const sc_inout<bool>& port, bool level );
00168     void async_reset_signal_is( const sc_out<bool>& port, bool level );
00169     void async_reset_signal_is( const sc_signal_in_if<bool>& iface, bool level);
00170     void reset_signal_is( const sc_in<bool>& port, bool level );
00171     void reset_signal_is( const sc_inout<bool>& port, bool level );
00172     void reset_signal_is( const sc_out<bool>& port, bool level );
00173     void reset_signal_is( const sc_signal_in_if<bool>& iface, bool level );
00174 
00175     // static sensitivity for SC_THREADs and SC_CTHREADs
00176 
00177     void wait()
00178         { ::sc_core::wait( simcontext() ); }
00179 
00180     // dynamic sensitivity for SC_THREADs and SC_CTHREADs
00181 
00182     void wait( const sc_event& e )
00183         { ::sc_core::wait( e, simcontext() ); }
00184 
00185     void wait( const sc_event_or_list& el )
00186         { ::sc_core::wait( el, simcontext() ); }
00187 
00188     void wait( const sc_event_and_list& el )
00189         { ::sc_core::wait( el, simcontext() ); }
00190 
00191     void wait( const sc_time& t )
00192         { ::sc_core::wait( t, simcontext() ); }
00193 
00194     void wait( double v, sc_time_unit tu )
00195         { ::sc_core::wait( sc_time( v, tu, simcontext() ), simcontext() ); }
00196 
00197     void wait( const sc_time& t, const sc_event& e )
00198         { ::sc_core::wait( t, e, simcontext() ); }
00199 
00200     void wait( double v, sc_time_unit tu, const sc_event& e )
00201         { ::sc_core::wait( 
00202                 sc_time( v, tu, simcontext() ), e, simcontext() ); }
00203 
00204     void wait( const sc_time& t, const sc_event_or_list& el )
00205         { ::sc_core::wait( t, el, simcontext() ); }
00206 
00207     void wait( double v, sc_time_unit tu, const sc_event_or_list& el )
00208         { ::sc_core::wait( sc_time( v, tu, simcontext() ), el, simcontext() ); }
00209 
00210     void wait( const sc_time& t, const sc_event_and_list& el )
00211         { ::sc_core::wait( t, el, simcontext() ); }
00212 
00213     void wait( double v, sc_time_unit tu, const sc_event_and_list& el )
00214         { ::sc_core::wait( sc_time( v, tu, simcontext() ), el, simcontext() ); }
00215 
00216 
00217     // static sensitivity for SC_METHODs
00218 
00219     void next_trigger()
00220         { ::sc_core::next_trigger( simcontext() ); }
00221 
00222 
00223     // dynamic sensitivty for SC_METHODs
00224 
00225     void next_trigger( const sc_event& e )
00226         { ::sc_core::next_trigger( e, simcontext() ); }
00227 
00228     void next_trigger( const sc_event_or_list& el )
00229         { ::sc_core::next_trigger( el, simcontext() ); }
00230

00232         { ::sc_core::next_trigger( el, simcontext() ); }
00233 
00234     void next_trigger( const sc_time& t )
00235         { ::sc_core::next_trigger( t, simcontext() ); }
00236 
00237     void next_trigger( double v, sc_time_unit tu )
00238         { ::sc_core::next_trigger( 
00239             sc_time( v, tu, simcontext() ), simcontext() ); }
00240 
00241     void next_trigger( const sc_time& t, const sc_event& e )
00242         { ::sc_core::next_trigger( t, e, simcontext() ); }
00243 
00244     void next_trigger( double v, sc_time_unit tu, const sc_event& e )
00245         { ::sc_core::next_trigger( 
00246                 sc_time( v, tu, simcontext() ), e, simcontext() ); }
00247 
00248     void next_trigger( const sc_time& t, const sc_event_or_list& el )
00249         { ::sc_core::next_trigger( t, el, simcontext() ); }
00250 
00251     void next_trigger( double v, sc_time_unit tu, const sc_event_or_list& el )
00252         { ::sc_core::next_trigger( 
00253             sc_time( v, tu, simcontext() ), el, simcontext() ); }
00254 
00255     void next_trigger( const sc_time& t, const sc_event_and_list& el )
00256         { ::sc_core::next_trigger( t, el, simcontext() ); }
00257 
00258     void next_trigger( double v, sc_time_unit tu, const sc_event_and_list& el )
00259         { ::sc_core::next_trigger( 
00260             sc_time( v, tu, simcontext() ), el, simcontext() ); }
00261 
00262 
00263     // for SC_METHODs and SC_THREADs and SC_CTHREADs
00264 
00265     bool timed_out()
00266         { return ::sc_core::timed_out(); }
00267 
00268 
00269     // for SC_CTHREADs
00270 
00271     void halt()
00272         { ::sc_core::halt( simcontext() ); }
00273 
00274     void wait( int n )
00275         { ::sc_core::wait( n, simcontext() ); }
00276 
00277     void at_posedge( const sc_signal_in_if<bool>& s )
00278         { ::sc_core::at_posedge( s, simcontext() ); }
00279 
00280     void at_posedge( const sc_signal_in_if<sc_dt::sc_logic>& s )
00281         { ::sc_core::at_posedge( s, simcontext() ); }
00282 
00283     void at_negedge( const sc_signal_in_if<bool>& s )
00284         { ::sc_core::at_negedge( s, simcontext() ); }
00285 
00286     void at_negedge( const sc_signal_in_if<sc_dt::sc_logic>& s )
00287         { ::sc_core::at_negedge( s, simcontext() ); }
00288 
00289     // Catch uses of watching:
00290     void watching( bool /* expr */ )
00291         { SC_REPORT_ERROR(SC_ID_WATCHING_NOT_ALLOWED_,""); }
00292 
00293     // These are protected so that user derived classes can refer to them.
00294     sc_sensitive     sensitive;
00295     sc_sensitive_pos sensitive_pos;
00296     sc_sensitive_neg sensitive_neg;
00297 
00298     // Function to set the stack size of the current (c)thread process.
00299     void set_stack_size( std::size_t );
00300 
00301     int append_port( sc_port_base* );
00302 
00303 private:
00304     sc_module( const sc_module& );
00305     const sc_module& operator = ( const sc_module& );
00306 
00307 private:
00308 
00309     bool                        m_end_module_called;
00310     std::vector<sc_port_base*>* m_port_vec;
00311     int                         m_port_index;
00312     sc_name_gen*                m_name_gen;
00313     sc_module_name*             m_module_name_p;
00314 
00315 public:

00391 
00392 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00393 // SOME MACROS TO SIMPLIFY SYNTAX:
00394 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00395 
00396 #define SC_MODULE(user_module_name)                                           \
00397     struct user_module_name : ::sc_core::sc_module
00398 
00399 #define SC_CTOR(user_module_name)                                             \
00400     typedef user_module_name SC_CURRENT_USER_MODULE;                          \
00401     user_module_name( ::sc_core::sc_module_name )
00402 
00403 // the SC_HAS_PROCESS macro call must be followed by a ;
00404 #define SC_HAS_PROCESS(user_module_name)                                      \
00405     typedef user_module_name SC_CURRENT_USER_MODULE
00406 
00407 // The this-> construct on sensitive operators in the macros below is
00408 // required for gcc 4.x when a templated class has a templated parent that is
00409 // derived from sc_module:
00410 //
00411 // template<typename X>
00412 // class B : public sc_module;
00413 // template<typename X>
00414 // class A : public B<X>
00415 
00416 #define declare_method_process(handle, name, host_tag, func)        \
00417     {                                                               \
00418         ::sc_core::sc_process_handle handle =                      \
00419             sc_core::sc_get_curr_simcontext()->create_method_process( \
00420                 name,  false, SC_MAKE_FUNC_PTR( host_tag, func ), \
00421                 this, 0 ); \
00422         this->sensitive << handle;                                        \
00423         this->sensitive_pos << handle;                                    \
00424         this->sensitive_neg << handle;                                    \
00425     }
00426 
00427 #define declare_thread_process(handle, name, host_tag, func)        \
00428     {                                                               \
00429         ::sc_core::sc_process_handle handle =                      \
00430              sc_core::sc_get_curr_simcontext()->create_thread_process( \
00431                  name,  false,           \
00432                  SC_MAKE_FUNC_PTR( host_tag, func ), this, 0 ); \
00433         this->sensitive << handle;                                        \
00434         this->sensitive_pos << handle;                                    \
00435         this->sensitive_neg << handle;                                    \
00436     }
00437 
00438 #define declare_cthread_process(handle, name, host_tag, func, edge) \
00439     {                                                               \
00440         ::sc_core::sc_process_handle handle =                     \
00441              sc_core::sc_get_curr_simcontext()->create_cthread_process( \
00442             name,  false,          \
00443                      SC_MAKE_FUNC_PTR( host_tag, func ), this, 0 ); \
00444         this->sensitive.operator() ( handle, edge );\
00445     }
00446 
00447 #define SC_CTHREAD(func, edge)                                                \
00448     declare_cthread_process( func ## _handle,                                 \
00449                              #func,                                           \
00450                              SC_CURRENT_USER_MODULE,                          \
00451                              func,                                            \
00452                              edge )
00453 
00454 #define SC_METHOD(func)                                                       \
00455     declare_method_process( func ## _handle,                                  \
00456                             #func,                                            \
00457                             SC_CURRENT_USER_MODULE,                           \
00458                             func )
00459 
00460 #define SC_THREAD(func)                                                       \
00461     declare_thread_process( func ## _handle,                                  \
00462                             #func,                                            \
00463                             SC_CURRENT_USER_MODULE,                           \
00464                             func )
00465 
00466 
00467 
00468 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00469 //  TYPEDEFS
00470 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00471 
00472 typedef sc_module sc_channel;
00473 typedef sc_module sc_behavior;
00474 
00475 } // namespace sc_core

00479   MODIFICATION LOG - modifiers, enter your name, affiliation, date and
00480   changes you are making here.
00481 
00482       Name, Affiliation, Date: Ali Dasdan, Synopsys, Inc.
00483   Description of Modification: - Implementation of operator() and operator,
00484                                  positional connection method.
00485                                - Implementation of error checking in
00486                                  operator<<'s.
00487                                - Implementation of the function test_module_prm.
00488                                - Implementation of set_stack_size().
00489 
00490       Name, Affiliation, Date: Gene Bushuyev, Synopsys, Inc.
00491   Description of Modification: - Change implementation for VC6.
00492 
00493       Name, Affiliation, Date: Andy Godorich, Forte
00494                                Bishnupriya Bhattacharya, Cadence Design Systems,
00495                                25 August, 2003
00496   Description of Modification: inherit from sc_process_host as a part of
00497                                implementing dynamic processes
00498 
00499  *****************************************************************************/

00549 // Revision 1.5  2006/03/14 23:56:58  acg
00550 //   Andy Goodrich: This fixes a bug when an exception is thrown in
00551 //   sc_module::sc_module() for a dynamically allocated sc_module
00552 //   object. We are calling sc_module::end_module() on a module that has
00553 //   already been deleted. The scenario runs like this:
00554 //
00555 //   a) the sc_module constructor is entered
00556 //   b) the exception is thrown
00557 //   c) the exception processor deletes the storage for the sc_module
00558 //   d) the stack is unrolled causing the sc_module_name instance to be deleted
00559 //   e) ~sc_module_name() calls end_module() with its pointer to the sc_module
00560 //   f) because the sc_module has been deleted its storage is corrupted,
00561 //      either by linking it to a free space chain, or by reuse of some sort
00562 //   g) the m_simc field is garbage
00563 //   h) the m_object_manager field is also garbage
00564 //   i) an exception occurs
00565 //
00566 //   This does not happen for automatic sc_module instances since the
00567 //   storage for the module is not reclaimed its just part of the stack.
00568 //
00569 //   I am fixing this by having the destructor for sc_module clear the
00570 //   module pointer in its sc_module_name instance. That cuts things at
00571 //   step (e) above, since the pointer will be null if the module has
00572 //   already been deleted. To make sure the module stack is okay, I call
00573 //   end-module() in ~sc_module in the case where there is an
00574 //   sc_module_name pointer lying around.
00575 //
00576 // Revision 1.4  2006/01/24 20:49:05  acg
00577 // Andy Goodrich: changes to remove the use of deprecated features within the
00578 // simulator, and to issue warning messages when deprecated features are used.
00579 //
00580 // Revision 1.3  2006/01/13 18:44:30  acg
00581 // Added $Log to record CVS changes into the source.

00583 #endif
